sentence: Bank earnings and performance Banks in the United States have experienced two consecutive years of record earnings, despite the recession and slow recovery, losses due to exposures to bankruptcies arising from corporate fraud, and record low interest rates.
The model should be back-tested to verify that the factors it uses deliver the level of losses that was assumed when the loans were made and priced.
The test of the models will come when we hit a period of significantly higher unemployment or falling incomes.
For subprime accounts, rapid growth of the account base can mask underlying revenue trends.
By relying on charge-off reports for the portfolio as a whole, portfolio growth was masking the increasing amount of loan losses.
